s1.sentence: Science 148 The following are the laws of refraction of light .

s2.sentence: ( i ) The incident ray , the refracted ray and the normal to the interface of two transparent media at the point of incidence , all lie in the same plane .

s3.sentence: ( ii ) The ratio of sine of angle of incidence to the sine of angle of refraction is a constant , for the light of a given colour and for the given pair of media .

s4.sentence: This law is also known as Snell ’s law of refraction .

s5.sentence: ( This is true for angle 0 < i < 90o )

s6.sentence: If i is the angle of incidence and r is the angle of refraction , then , sin sin i r = constant ( 9.4 )

s7.sentence: This constant value is called the refractive index of the second medium with respect to the first .

s8.sentence: Let us study about refractive index in some detail .

s10.sentence: The Refractive Index You have already studied that a ray of light that travels obliquely from one transparent medium into another will change its direction in the second medium .

s11.sentence: The extent of the change in direction that takes place in a given pair of media may be expressed in terms of the refractive index , the “ constant ” appearing on the right hand side of Eq. ( 9.4 ) .

s12.sentence: The refractive index can be linked to an important physical quantity , the relative speed of propagation of light in different media .

s13.sentence: It turns out that light propagates with different speeds in different media .

s14.sentence: Light travels fastest in vacuum with speed of 3×108 m s–1 .

s15.sentence: In air , the speed of light is only marginally less , compared to that in vacuum .

s16.sentence: It reduces considerably in glass or water .

s17.sentence: The value of the refractive index for a given pair of media depends upon the speed of light in the two media , as given below .

s18.sentence: Consider a ray of light travelling from medium 1 into medium 2 , as shown in Fig.9.11 .

s19.sentence: Let v1 be the speed of light in medium 1 and v2 be the speed of light in medium 2 .

s20.sentence: The refractive index of medium 2 with respect to medium 1 is given by the ratio of the speed of light in medium 1 and the speed of light in medium 2 .

s21.sentence: Experiments show that refraction of light occurs according to certain laws .

s36.sentence: Light – Reflection and Refraction 147 In this Activity , you will note , the light ray has changed its direction at points O and O ′ .

s37.sentence: Note that both the points O and O ′ lie on surfaces separating two transparent media .

s38.sentence: Draw a perpendicular NN ’ to AB at O and another perpendicular MM ′ to CD at O ′ .

s39.sentence: The light ray at point O has entered from a rarer medium to a denser medium , that is , from air to glass .

s40.sentence: Note that the light ray has bent towards the normal .

s41.sentence: At O ′ , the light ray has entered from glass to air , that is , from a denser medium to a rarer medium .

s42.sentence: The light here has bent away from the normal .

s43.sentence: Compare the angle of incidence with the angle of refraction at both refracting surfaces AB and CD .

s46.sentence: You may observe that the emergent ray is parallel to the direction of the incident ray .

s49.sentence: This is why the ray emerges parallel to the incident ray .
